body.p:
Without solicitation on the part of any one, but prompted by feelings proper. I would ask of you the extention of Mercy & Executive clemency towords an unfortunate Young ^man^ Condemned to the penetentiary this term of this court by the name of James Carrol, from what I have learned as to the testimony submitted to the Jury (I not being present being sick & confined to my room, but speak from what I heard the Commonwealths atty say) he has hitherto engaged an first rate character for honesty, sobriety, & industrious habits, & up to the unfortunate troubles of the County he was attentive to his humble but honorable occupation by them he was thrown out of employment & being Young he must have been mislead by bad & designing men into this most deplorable situation his father is an old citizen of this town & in every respect worthy of high consideration & I cannot too strongly urge you to interpose your power & spare him from down to the sorrow to the grave -- I would be glad to hear from you generally adeiu Dr Govr & believe me under all circumstances & to the last extremity
truely and ever your friend
